text:
The Tiwi Islands are a group of islands part of the Northern Territory, Australia. The islands are to the north of Darwin, split by the Timor Sea. The islands are Melville Island (Australia's third largest island), Bathurst Island, as well as nine smaller islands. The combined area of the Tiwi Islands is. As of the 2016 census, 2,453 people lived on the islands.
The Tiwi people are indigenous to the islands.
